problem: What speed would a 1.0-g paper clip have if it had the same kinetic energy as a molecule at 22°C?

correctFormulas.name: Average kinetic energy of a molecule

steps.explanation: State the fundamental formulas we will use
steps.notations: We will use the kinetic energy formula KE = ½mv² and the average molecular kinetic energy formula KE_avg = (3/2)k_B T

steps.explanation: Define variables with values given in the problem
Equate the kinetic energy of the paper clip to the average kinetic energy of a molecule
Solve for the paper clip speed v
steps.notations: v² = 3k_B T / m ⇒ v = √(3k_B T / m)

steps.explanation: Substitute the numerical values into the formula
